description: Tools manifest for Free Agent autonomous operations

get_time.name: Get Time
get_time.description: Get the current date and time in a specified timezone

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

get_weather.name: Get Weather
get_weather.description: Get current weather and forecast for a location

location.description: City name or location (e.g., 'London', 'New York, NY')

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

brave_search.name: Web Search
brave_search.description: Search the web using Brave Search API. Returns titles, URLs, and descriptions.

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute (e.g., 'search_results'). Use {{name}} in scratchpad or read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

google_search.name: Google Search
google_search.description: Search the web using Google Custom Search API.

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use {{name}} in scratchpad or read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

web_scrape.name: Web Scrape
web_scrape.description: Fetch and extract content from a web page. Handles HTML, PDF, and DOCX files. Returns cleaned text content.

returnHtml.description: Return raw HTML instead of extracted text

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use {{name}} in scratchpad or read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

read_github_repo.name: Read GitHub Repository Structure
read_github_repo.description: Get the file structure of a GitHub repository. Returns file PATHS and SIZES only - NOT file contents. Use read_github_file to fetch actual file contents after identifying which files you need.

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use {{name}} in scratchpad or read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

read_github_file.name: Read GitHub File
read_github_file.description: Read the contents of specific files from a GitHub repository. Can fetch multiple files at once.

selectedPaths.description: Array of file paths within the repository to read

outputMode.description: combined returns all files in one string, separate returns each file separately

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use {{name}} in scratchpad or read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

read_blackboard.name: Read Blackboard
read_blackboard.description: Read all entries from the agent's blackboard memory. The blackboard persists thoughts, observations, and progress across iterations.

write_blackboard.name: Write Blackboard
write_blackboard.description: Write an entry to the agent's blackboard memory. Use to track observations, insights, decisions, and progress.

read_file.name: Read File
read_file.description: Read content from a user-provided file in the current session. Files are provided by the user at session start.

fileId.description: ID of the file to read (from session files)

read_attribute.name: Read Attribute
read_attribute.description: Retrieve saved tool result attributes. Call with empty names array to list all attributes, or with specific names to get their full content.

names.description: Array of attribute names to retrieve. Empty array returns metadata for all available attributes.

read_artifact.name: Read Artifact
read_artifact.description: Read artifacts created in this session. Call with empty ids array to list all artifacts with metadata, or with specific ids/titles to get their full content.

ids.description: Array of artifact IDs or titles to retrieve. Empty array returns metadata for all available artifacts.

read_scratchpad.name: Read Scratchpad
read_scratchpad.description: Read the current contents of the scratchpad. The scratchpad is your working output area visible to the user. Use to review results before sending to output or API. Handlebar placeholders like {{attribute_name}} will be substituted with actual attribute content.

returns.description: Current scratchpad content with attribute substitutions

write_scratchpad.name: Write Scratchpad
write_scratchpad.description: Write or append content to the scratchpad. The scratchpad is visible to the user in real-time. Use to store working results, analysis outputs, or temporary data.

mode.description: Whether to replace all content or append to existing

read_prompt.name: Read Prompt
read_prompt.description: Read the original user prompt/instructions. Use to reference back to the task requirements at any time.

read_prompt_files.name: Read Prompt Files
read_prompt_files.description: Get list of files provided by the user with metadata (id, name, type, size). Use to understand available file inputs before reading them.

read_zip_contents.name: Read ZIP Contents
read_zip_contents.description: List all files and directories inside a ZIP archive without extracting.

action.description: Action to perform (always 'list' for this tool)

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

read_zip_file.name: Read ZIP File Entry
read_zip_file.description: Extract and read a specific file from a ZIP archive.

action.description: Action to perform (always 'read' for this tool)

entryPath.description: Path to file within the ZIP archive

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

extract_zip_files.name: Extract ZIP Files
extract_zip_files.description: Extract all or selected files from a ZIP archive.

action.description: Action to perform (always 'extract' for this tool)

paths.description: Specific paths to extract (extracts all if empty)

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

pdf_info.name: Get PDF Info
pdf_info.description: Get information about a PDF file including page count and metadata.

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

pdf_extract_text.name: Extract PDF Text
pdf_extract_text.description: Extract text content from a PDF file.

pages.description: Page numbers to extract (1-indexed, all if empty)

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

ocr_image.name: OCR Image
ocr_image.description: Extract text from an image using optical character recognition.

imageSource.description: Base64 data, data URI, or image URL

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

send_email.name: Send Email
send_email.description: Send an email using Resend. Supports plain text or HTML content.

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

request_assistance.name: Request Assistance
request_assistance.description: Pause execution and request input, clarification, or files from the user. Execution resumes when user responds.

question.description: Question or request to show the user

context.description: Additional context explaining why assistance is needed

inputType.description: Type of input expected from user

image_generation.name: Generate Image
image_generation.description: Generate an image from a text prompt using Gemini's image generation model.

prompt.description: Detailed description of the image to generate

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

elevenlabs_tts.name: Text to Speech
elevenlabs_tts.description: Convert text to speech using ElevenLabs API.

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

export_word.name: Export Word Document
export_word.description: Create a Word (.docx) document from markdown content and save as artifact.

export_pdf.name: Export PDF
export_pdf.description: Create a PDF document from markdown content and save as artifact.

pronghorn_post.name: Pronghorn Post
pronghorn_post.description: Send artifacts (text, images, binary) to a Pronghorn project for collection. Use for exporting results, reports, or generated content to external storage.

projectId.description: Pronghorn project ID to send artifacts to

items.description: Array of items to send. Each item has: type ('text'|'image'|'binary'), content (string or base64), optional title, fileName, contentType. Supports {{scratchpad}}, {{attribute:name}}, {{artifact:id}} references in content.

content.description: Content to send - plain text or base64 encoded. Supports reference placeholders.

contentType.description: Optional MIME type for binary content

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

get_call_api.name: GET API Call
get_call_api.description: Make a GET request to an external API endpoint. Use for fetching data from REST APIs.

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use {{name}} in scratchpad or read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

post_call_api.name: POST API Call
post_call_api.description: Make a POST request to an external API endpoint. Use for sending data to REST APIs.

saveAs.description: Save result to a named attribute. Use {{name}} in scratchpad or read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

read_database_schemas.name: Read Database Schemas
read_database_schemas.description: Retrieve the complete schema structure from a PostgreSQL database including tables, columns, data types, constraints, and foreign key relationships. Use this BEFORE execute_sql to understand the database structure. Returns organized schema information for query planning.

connectionString.description: PostgreSQL connection string (e.g., postgres://user:pass@host:port/database). SSL will be enforced automatically.

schemas.description: Filter to specific schema names (default: all non-system schemas like 'public')

saveAs.description: Save schema structure to a named attribute for reference when building queries.

execute_sql.name: Execute SQL
execute_sql.description: Execute SQL queries on an external PostgreSQL database. Supports both read (SELECT) and write (INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE) operations. Multiple statements can be separated by semicolons and will be executed sequentially. Use read_database_schemas first to understand the database structure.

connectionString.description: PostgreSQL connection string (e.g., postgres://user:pass@host:port/database). SSL will be enforced automatically.

query.description: SQL query to execute. Multiple statements can be separated by semicolons.

isWrite.description: Set to true for INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE operations

params.description: Parameterized query values for security (applies to single-statement queries)

saveAs.description: Save query results as JSON to a named attribute. Use read_attribute(['name']) to retrieve.

read_self.name: Read Self Configuration
read_self.description: Introspect your own system prompt configuration. Returns all editable sections, tool overrides, and disabled items. Use to understand your current configuration before modifying.

include.description: What to return: sections only, tools only, or all configuration

write_self.name: Write Self Configuration
write_self.description: Modify your own system prompt configuration. Changes take effect in the next iteration. Use carefully - this modifies your behavior. IMPORTANT: Use addSections to create NEW sections, sectionOverrides only works for EXISTING sections.

sectionOverrides.description: Map of EXISTING sectionId to new content. Valid IDs: identity, memory_architecture, correct_workflow, loop_problem, anti_loop_rules, loop_self_reflection, tool_execution_timing, response_format, blackboard_mandatory, data_handling, workflow_summary, accessing_attributes, reference_resolution. Use addSections to create NEW sections.

addSections.description: Add new custom sections: [{id?: string, title: string, content: string}]. ID is auto-generated if not provided.

items.id: string (optional) - Custom ID for the section, auto-generated if omitted
items.title: string (required) - Section title displayed in UI

deleteSections.description: IDs of custom sections to delete. Only works for sections added via addSections.

toolDescriptionOverrides.description: Map of toolId to new description

spawn.name: Spawn Child Agents
spawn.description: Create child agent instances for parallel work. Each child receives your current memory plus modifications. You will enter orchestrate mode until children complete.

children.description: Array of child specifications: [{name, task, maxIterations?, sectionOverrides?, attributes?}]

items.name: string (required) - Unique identifier for this child
items.task: string (required) - Specific task/prompt for this child

completionThreshold.description: Resume orchestrator after this many children complete (default: all)
